benchmark_details.name: ProfileBench
benchmark_details.overview: ProfileBench is an industry-derived benchmark from a large-scale video platform, encompassing heterogeneous user data and a systematic profiling taxonomy, enabling standardized evaluation for user profiling tasks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a standardized benchmark for evaluating label-free user profiling approaches using heterogeneous user data.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Limited to six core dimensions; currently lacks fine-grained user attribute capture.

data.source: Derived from a large-scale video platform, includes user-generated behavioral and demographic cues.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on multi-dimensional predictions against the curated gold standard.
methodology.interpretation: Higher values in F1 Score indicate better overall performance in user profiling.
methodology.baseline_results: CONF-PROFILE achieves an average F1 of 73.03, outperforming several SOTA models.
methodology.validation: Extensive experiments validated the effectiveness of the CONF-PROFILE framework.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: All data collected were from users who explicitly consented to their information being used for research. Personally identifiable information was anonymized prior to processing.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: User consent obtained prior to data collection.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.compliance_with_regulations: The study followed ethical research guidelines and ensured compliance with privacy standards.
